title: Letwin amendment could dampen strongest pound surge in a decade as City faces more uncertainty
text:
The pound’s strongest surge in a decade is expected to be dampened if Boris Johnson delays a vote on his Brexit deal as the City braces for more uncertainty.

Currency strategists warned that MPs backing Oliver Letwin’s amendment would knock sterling from its five-month high after it skyrocketed on hopes of a Brexit breakthrough.

Jordan Rochester at Nomura warned that the pound would be hit by "some profit taking" and would pull back "as the market expects further time wasting". It raises the risk that “we go pretty much nowhere on Monday and stay in this limbo”, he said.
